articles.title: 'We get by day to day': Argentina's high poverty rate dips as pandemic eases
articles.description: The government said on Thursday the poverty rate dipped to 40.6% in the first half of 2021 from 42% before, in the country of 45 million people that is rich in natural resources from cattle and corn to natural gas, but plagued by inflation, economic mismanagement and years of cyclical debt crises. "Sometimes we can only eat only so much.
articles.content: Eduardo David Rodriguez takes bags of fruit and vegetables to sell at a fresh produce market in Buenos Aires twice a week to make ends meet for his family. They barely do. Rodriguez, like some four in 10 Argentines, lives below the poverty line, a ra... [1877 chars]

articles.title: Rugby-Argentina players kicked out of Rugby Championship after COVID rules breach
articles.description: New Zealand coach Ian Foster said the COVID rules were "clear and obvious" to his team. "It's very transparent to us that there’s a border between Queensland and New South Wales," Foster told reporters.
articles.content: Six Argentina players and two staff have been kicked out of the Rugby Championship for breaching its health rules after taking an unauthorised day trip to the New South Wales resort of Byron Bay, competition organisers said on Thursday. The Rugby Cha... [3097 chars]

articles.title: Six Argentine players barred from Wallabies clash after Covid breach
articles.description: Argentina's Rugby Championship clash with Australia was thrown into chaos Thursday after six players were ruled out for breaching coronavirus restrictions with an unauthorised trip to a health retreat.
articles.content:
Argentina's scrumhalf Felipe Ezcurra (C) was among the six players ruled out

articles.title: Wallabies prop Greg Holmes to make comeback in Rugby Championship match against Argentina, oldest Wallaby since world war two
articles.description: Greg Holmes is set to become the oldest Wallaby since World War II when he lines up in the gold jersey for Saturday’s Rugby Championship clash with Argentina on the Gold Coast.
articles.content:
Western Force prop Greg Holmes will make history in the Wallabies’ final clash of the Rugby Championship this weekend.

articles.description: Wallabies coach Dave Rennie concedes the Queensland Government’s “constant” changing of Covid-19 regulations has caused “a bit of frustration” during the Rugby Championship.

articles.title: All Blacks seek perfection as Argentina limp to finish
articles.description: New Zealand will look to cement their claim as top dogs in the southern hemisphere when they close the Rugby Championship against South Africa on Saturday after Argentina seek a face-saving win over Australia at the end of a wretched campaign.

articles.title: Rugby-Argentina Players Kicked Out Of Rugby Championship After COVID Rules Breach
articles.description: MELBOURNE:Six Argentina players and two staff have been kicked out of the Rugby Championship for breaching tournament health rules after taking an unauthorised trip to the New South Wales resort of Byron Bay, tournament organisers said on Thursday.
